output: There are different ways to calculate attention, but one commonly used method is Scaled Dot-Product Attention. In this method, the input consists of queries and keys of dimension dk, and values of dimension dv. The dot products of the query with all keys are computed, divided by the square root of dk, and a softmax function is applied to obtain the weights on the values. The attention function can be computed on a set of queries simultaneously, packed together into a matrix Q, with the keys and values also packed together into matrices K and V. The matrix of outputs is then computed as Attention(Q, K, V) = softmax(QKT/\u221adk)V. (Source: 1706.03762.pdf)
